Q1

Class ListGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Q1.AbstractGraph
      • Q1.ListGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph

    public class ListGraph
extends AbstractGraph
    A ListGraph is an extension of the AbstractGraph abstract class that uses an array of lists to represent the edges.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.List<Edge>[] edges
      An array of Lists to contain the edges that originate with each vertex.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ListGraph(int numV, boolean directed)
      Construct a graph with the specified number of vertices and directionality.

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge(int source,
                    int dest)
        Get the edge between two vertices. If an edge does not exist, an Edge with a weight of Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY is returned.
        Parameters:
        source - The source
        dest - The destination
        Returns:
        the edge between these two vertices

      • loadEdgesFromFile

        public void loadEdgesFromFile(java.io.BufferedReader bufferedReader)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Load the edges of a graph from the data in an input file. The file should contain a series of lines, each line with two or three data values. The first is the source the second is the destination, and the optional third is the weight
        Overrides:
        loadEdgesFromFile in class AbstractGraph
        Parameters:
        bufferedReader - The BufferedReader that is connected to the file that contains the data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - If an I/O error occurs
